intro: Lindsaea microstegia, commonly known as the small-stemmed lindsaea, is a species of epiphytic fern native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, linear leaves that often form dense, compact rosettes. The plant produces small, clustered sporangia on the underside of its fronds, which are typically covered with a thin, protective layer. Lindsaea microstegia thrives in humid, shaded environments, often growing on tree trunks or branches in the understory of tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on epiphytic plant adaptations and biodiversity in tropical ecosystems.
